page.title: 03LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: Corse and Staunton have separate parish councils. Mr Dent is Chairman of Staunton Parish Council and Mr Lewis of Corse Parish Council. The councillors are elected every 3 years. They look after the footpaths and discuss whether new houses ought to be built. The Forest of Dean District Council at Cinderford is responsible for refuse collection once a week, drains and sewers. The County Council in Gloucester is responsible for the police, education, fire service, roads and the library van. When we have general elections our school is closed for the people of Corse to vote in. Staunton people vote in Staunton Church Hall. Our Member of Parliament is Paul Marland, M.P. for West Gloucestershire.
